name: Tips on the right PW to join?
author: Cornflower

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
I'm looking for a PW to replace Blackstone Keep. (Blackstone Keep is awesome, but I've been playing there for so long I need to change things up a bit.)

I hope I can get some tips here. I'm looking for this:
- No hardcore rest restrictions.
- No permadeath or "10 deaths and you're permadead" or other silly death penalties that takes 15 minutes just to read through.
- Some way to avoid PvP if you don't want to.
- Some players to RP with if I feel like it.
- Allows multiclassing without too many restrictions.
- Cool items.
- Possible to quest/level up alone.

So, any suggestions?

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
What do you mean by hardcore rest restrictions?

Sent from my SM-N900P using Tapatalk

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content: Well, you need food and a bedroll to rest and you can't rest more than once a month/year/decade. Also you can't rest in lot of areas, only in taverns and stuff.

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
Ah.
Let me mention world of Greyhawk then. It is a mid magic place, deemed a challenge by many. It does have some restrictions on resting, you can't do it every where, but you can do it most places out doors, once every 16 minutes of real life, if you have a bedroll , or I believe 32 minutes otherwise. Many dungeons /caves/etc also have a place where it is safe enough to bed down in.

There is a discussion on that place active now.

Sent from my SM-N900P using Tapatalk


Edit... Oh you need food to rest as well.

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content: I'll try it. It seems to be very hard to solo, though.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Cornflower wrote: I'll try it. It seems to be very hard to solo, though.
I started playing WoG I think about 2 weeks ago. I've been playing solo. Got to level 21 on Druid which is probably one of the most favourable classes to play on the PW (maybe Cleric is stronger?). Its definitely a challenging module. Expect to learn how to run, expect to die a few times etc. 

Monsters do have a very good chance of killing you, they often use stealth (meaning spot and listen are USEFUL, like i mean in the OC I just sold that Watchman's helm in WoG I equip it most of the time!), ranged weapons if they cant reach you, will use dispel magic against any buffs you have (High caster levels are useful to counter this!). Some of the archers will run away from you if you are getting close to them in melee, and shoot poisoned arrows (ie strength damage etc) too! This PW means business :)

It is always fun for me (I was playing through NWN Bioware OC/SOU/HOTU and Aielund and got totally bored with point and click after a while without having to ever use consumables). I find it forces me to use all the tools available in the game, which is what I like. 

I'd suggest a few threads to read if you do want to play WoG which helped me!

https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/worldof ... t2946.html

playing-better-the-importance-of-knowle ... 54384.html

Probably the most useful strategy is 'Pull and slay, or run away'! (I was taught this rhyming phrase from another experienced WoG player). 

Which basically means get small amounts of enemies to come to you with a ranged weapon + retreating, and see if you can deal with them via your usual means. If you can't RUN away :)

There are some small changes to spells and feats which are listed on the website here: http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/index.html

If all else fails and you are really struggling the WoG players on the forum have been fantastic. They have been very welcoming of new players and have helped me settle in and adjust to the PW to the extent I really enjoy playing it. 

I'm happy to help too if you need it, although others are far more experienced at the PW than I am :)


Edit: by the way dont get too stressed RE Solo. With solo play I found being a few levels above what is needed to play the area in a party a useful guide. Dying is only 50 exp / level at the moment, and 10% gold, so it is not excessively punishing if you dont carry a lot of gold

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Do the same question on Beamdog's forums too, Cornflower, you are bound to get way more answers there, as many creators advertise their PWs & search constantly for new players.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: Do the same question on Beamdog's forums too, Cornflower, you are bound to get way more answers there, as many creators advertise their PWs & search constantly for new players.
Valerfor has a point there. You are right in that it is hard to solo WoG and the amount of detail required in my post has probably suggested that is the case. It may not be the right PW unless you like a challenge (which I love! LOL). The only other PWs I have tried is Arelith and I think Nordock (I will have to check, I am not 100%). 

Edit: You might enjoy this thread LOL (https://neverwintervault.org/forums/nev ... orlds-nwn1)

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: Do the same question on Beamdog's forums too, Cornflower, you are bound to get way more answers there, as many creators advertise their PWs & search constantly for new players.
Actually, so far I have gotten a couple of answers here but none on the beamdog forum. We'll see what happens in a couple of more hours though. Timezones and stuff...

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote:
Cornflower wrote:Actually, so far I have gotten a couple of answers here but none on the beamdog forum. We'll see what happens in a couple of more hours though. Timezones and stuff...
We love our forum :)

Forgotten Realms Cormyr looks interesting: http://frc.proboards.com/ - its been running for 14 years now. Forum is still pretty active. Haven't had any experience playing it though.
Thank you, I checked it out. It's a bit restricted for me, for instance, you can't run from point A to point B, it's considered bad RP. Go figure.... I've been a DM on pen and paper for more years than most of you been alive, as well as build two PW:s myself. I think someone is confusing ease of play with bad RP... When you play on PnP, you don't sit around the table waiting 2 months to play because it would take your characters that long time to travel across the lands. That's just plain silly.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I've recently tried weeding out redundant sites listed in this sub-forum, and all those that remain (bar a couple - I like to retain a little caution) still have active sites/links, so might be worth checking out, or at least giving a read. And we'll be looking at updating Hip's Listing of PWs when we can - though that might take some ongoing micro-maintenance.

More importantly - yeah - we got people awake, interested, and mouthy all over the world here! To quote Bill and Ted: "Excellent!" (guitar solo).

Go well - cheers!

EDIT: Sorry, meant to mention, many of us here are also old-timers (speaking for myself, I'm much better with D&D 1 and 2 than 3 - let alone all the rest!) Oh, and no offence to the young striplings among us!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Try that on WoG, you'll walk for days

I have played in role-playing servers before & loved it, but ultimately one should remember that this is an action-game & not real life. There are other games for that reason (Sims, if that is still around).

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
WoG is very well developed.

You could also try Bastion of Peace.  It was started by one of the old Lalaland players when that server closed down last year, and is still being actively developed.

My only negative is that it can become a bit grindy after a while as all loot is randomly generated.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
I play on Nordock Martial Age.  I like it.  Cool gear and cool quests.  Level up to level 120.  I like the
subraces too 

http://nordockmartialage.altervista.org ... =Main_Page
